newsitem.title: TAIWAN: Taiwan to announce winning phone bidders on Jan 4.
newsitem.headline: Taiwan to announce winning phone bidders on Jan 4.

text.p: The Taiwan government will announce the winning bidders for the island's eight mobile telephone operation licences on January 4, an official said on Saturday.
The official, who asked not to be named, said the Ministry of Transportation and Communication was "very close to" finalising its selections.
"I understand that the winners will be announced on January 4, which is pretty much according to schedule," the official said by telephone.
The ministry had said it would finish screening the bids by the end of 1996.

Seventeen joint ventures, some involving major international telecom firms, have submitted 42 applications for the newly liberalised mobile telephone franchises which analysts say could yield up to US$3.6 billion in annual sales in 10 years.
Some of the foreign and domestic applicants are AT&T, Sprint Corp, Southwestern Bell, Bank of Tokyo-Mitsubishi, Air Touch, Acer Inc and the influential Koo's Group of Taiwan.
The mobile telephone sector is one of several liberalised in January 1996 when parliament dismantled a decades-old state monopoly by opening the sectors to private and limited foreign investments.
